title: Lemon Loaf Cake Recipe
description: This lemon loaf is easy to make, tender, and moist, topped with a sweet glaze for a deliciously tangy loaf cake bursting with lemon flavor!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Lemon Cake Recipes Lemon Loaf Cake 4.6 (24) 21 Reviews 14 Photos This homemade lemon loaf is tender and moist and has that delicious tart lemon zing and flavor. I like to top it with a sweet glaze for that perfect sweet and tangy combination! Submitted by seth martin Updated on April 15, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (8x4-inch) lemon loaf Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ½ cup butter ½ cup white sugar 2 large eggs ½ cup sour cream 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon freshly grated lemon zest, or more to taste 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour ¼ cup cornstarch ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon baking soda 2 cups confectioners' sugar 3 tablespoons lemon juice or to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease an 8x4-inch loaf pan. Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until fluffy and lighter in color. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in sour cream, vanilla, and lemon zest; beat for 2 minutes. Combine flour, cornstarch, salt, and baking soda in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating until just incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in the pan briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. To make the glaze: Whisk confectioners' sugar and lemon juice together in a medium bowl until smooth. Place cooled cake on a serving plate and pour glaze over entire cake; allow glaze to dry before serving. I Made It Print 57 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Lemon Loaf Cake 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 14 Photo by  Sandra McLaren Boos 11/07/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Tastes very good with just the right amount of lemon with the glaze. It took 45 minutes in 350 degree oven ❣️ 03 of 14 Photo by  ivette 03/10/2021 04 of 14 Photo by  Linda T 08/29/2020 Tasty cake.. very lemony. I added a bit more zest. The glaze was very sweet so I would use less next time... and add some almonds. I made these as cupcakes since I live alone and can toss the rest in freezer. I baked them for 20 minutes at 325... got 10 cupcakes 05 of 14 Photo by  MommaBean3 08/01/2020 Oh this was fantastic! I made the recipe as is and wouldn’t change a thing! 06 of 14 Photo by  SunnyDaysNora 07/06/2020 Delicious! After reading other reviews about needing a stronger lemon flavor I added a box of lemon pudding mix to the flour. I think this thickened the batter just a little too much too I thinned it out a bit with a small bit of milk. The icing was very thick and there wasn't enough liquid to make creamy instead of powdery so I thinned it with a bit of milk and some lemon extract. 07 of 14 Photo by  Paula 07/04/2020 I mostly followed this recipe but made 3 changes: 1)I added the zest of an entire lemon to the cake batter instead of just a teaspoon, 2)I used a 9x5-inch loaf pan instead of 8x4, and 3)I cooked the cake for 40 minutes instead of 30-35. I did not have the problem of the cake being wet in the center, perhaps due to the larger pan and longer cook time. The cake was not light and fluffy but more like a dense pound cake. My only complaint is that I would like for the cake part to have tasted lemony. Perhaps next time I will add some lemon extract to the batter. The glaze really delivers on the lemon taste. I added a little zest on top to pretty it up. 08 of 14 Photo by  debra 04/12/2020 09 of 14 Photo by  debra 04/12/2020 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Best Ever Lemon Drizzle Cake 9 Ratings Lemon Drizzle Loaf Cake 3 Ratings Lemon Pound Cake with Aunt Evelyn's Lemon Glaze 561 Ratings Lemon Shortbread Cookies 32 Ratings Best Carrot Cake Cupcakes 27 Ratings Rainbow Citrus Cake 78 Ratings Ginger Cookies with Orange Glaze 1 Rating Lemon Coconut Cupcakes 22 Ratings Lemon-Lime Cupcakes 60 Ratings Linzer Cookies 10 Ratings Spelt Oatmeal Raisin Cookies 5 Ratings Lemon Cake 412 Ratings The Best Lemon Bars 3,714 Ratings Best Bake Sale Banana Muffins 1 Rating Lemon Square Bars 1,107 Ratings Cranberry Pistachio Biscotti 1,872 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: seth martin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease an 8x4-inch loaf pan.;Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until fluffy and lighter in color. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in sour cream, vanilla, and lemon zest; beat for 2 minutes. Combine flour, cornstarch, salt, and baking soda in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating until just incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in the pan briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.;To make the glaze: Whisk confectioners' sugar and lemon juice together in a medium bowl until smooth. Place cooled cake on a serving plate and pour glaze over entire cake; allow glaze to dry before serving.
